Example 1: Differentiability at a Point

Determine whether the function \( f(x) = |x| \) is differentiable at \( x = 0 \).

Solution:

  1. Check Continuity at \( x = 0 \):

    • The function \( f(x) = |x| \) is continuous for all \( x \), including \( x = 0 \).
      \[ f(0) = |0| = 0, \quad \text{and } \lim_{{x \to 0}} f(x) = 0. \] Thus, \( f(x) \) is continuous at \( x = 0 \).

Ex1.

Determine whether the function \( f(x) = |x - 1| \) is differentiable at \( x = 1 \).

Solution

  1. Check Continuity:

    • The function \( f(x) = |x - 1| \) is continuous for all \( x \), including \( x = 1 \).
      \[ f(1) = |1 - 1| = 0, \quad \text{and } \lim_{{x \to 1}} f(x) = 0. \] Thus, \( f(x) \) is continuous at \( x = 1 \).
